article.description: Eddie Jones scored 26 points, including 5-of-8 shooting from 3-point range, as the Miami Heat beat Atlanta 99-79 Monday night to end the Hawks' three-game winning streak.
article.headline: Jones' shooting spree too much for Hawks
article.linkText: Jones gets hot from deep in Heat's rout of Hawks
article.story:
MIAMI (AP) -- The Miami Heat aren't used to winning easily. Eddie Jones scored 26 points, including 5-of-8 shooting from 3-point range, as Miami beat Atlanta 99-79 Monday night to end the Hawks' three-game winning streak.
Jones

It was the Heat's first double-digit victory in 17 games -- since a 107-73 win Jan. 1 in Atlanta. "It's an unusual experience for me to be in that position in the fourth quarter,'' Miami coach Pat Riley said. Brian Grant got his 19th double-double of the season with 11 points and 14 rebounds, and the Heat bench outscored Atlanta's reserves 39-15. LaPhonso Ellis led the charge with a season-high 15 points, and Mike James added 13. "I just try to be out there and impact the game,'' Ellis said. "My job here is to play defense and be a support player to my teammates, and to knock down shots when I get them.'' Shareef Abdur-Rahim had 19 points and 10 rebounds, but poor shooting by his teammates left the Hawks short of scoring. Jason Terry was 5-of-13 for 13 points, and Glenn Robinson shot 5-for-18 from the floor for 12 points. "They double-teamed me all night, which I didn't realize until the fourth quarter,'' Robinson said. "It definitely wasn't one of my better games.'' Theo Ratliff said Atlanta's 20 turnovers, which led to 24 Miami points, were the biggest factor. "We always lose when we have those types of games. You can't give them that many opportunities,'' he said. "Plus, when we turn it over, they run it back on the fastbreak and put the pressure back on your defense.'' The Heat went on a 17-0 run in the first half, their best of the year. They added a 10-0 spurt in the third quarter, and an 11-0 surge in the fourth. The Heat led by only one point at halftime, then outscored the Hawks 30-15 in the third quarter. "We went into the third quarter with our minds made up that we were going to defend, move the ball and make shots,'' Jones said. "It didn't come down to the last shot because we did things defensively tonight.'' It was the last game before a weeklong layoff for the Hawks, with the All-Star game in Atlanta on Sunday. "I think fatigue kicked in a little bit on us tonight,'' Robinson said. "We just weren't able to keep the momentum going into the break.'' Abdur-Rahim said one loss shouldn't take away from the Hawks' recent success, with five wins in seven games. "We're still in a good stretch,'' he said. "We just have to come back and start back up where we left off and hopefully try to turn this thing around.''

Game notes
Heat F Caron Butler was named Eastern Conference rookie of the month for January. He was also named the top rookie in November. ... The Heat's last five losses are by seven points or less. ... Abdur-Rahim scored 29 points against the Heat in their first meeting of the season, but only combined for 28 over the next two.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
